question: Which rank  has been achieved by India in World Economic Forum report on Gender gap?
explanation: On December 17, the World Economic Forum released its report according to which India ranked 112<sup>th</sup> in terms of gender gap. The report said that the India was ranked in bottom-five in terms of survival and economic participation.India was in 108<sup>th</sup> position in 2018. Its performance weakened in the year 2019 according to the report. India’s performance was lagging in three out of four metrics used for ranking the countries. India slipped to 150<sup>th</sup> rank in health and survival, 149<sup>th</sup> in economic participation, 112<sup>th</sup> in educational attainment. India improved to 18<sup>th</sup> place in terms of political empowerment.
